So there's companies like Apple and Costco,
who made the case that their policies
are ultimately beneficial to the bottom line.

One way to sort
of wait out the current backlash,

is a lot of companies are pulling back
from their sort of splashy PR campaigns

that happened in the wake
of George Floyd's murder

but they're not pulling back as much on
policies that are effective day to day

in the workplace
because they recognize that

diversity is ultimately
beneficial to their business.

It allows them to gain market share and it
allows them to recruit and retain talent
and they don't want to give that up.

So one way to wait
out the moment is to

continue the programs that are less
controversial but effective for business.
